timeline.message: Add installation and installtion repositories event

timeline.bodyText: Construct a new object to represent the repository since the payload only contains a small part of GHRepository; it would to safer to use. But not so sure where we should put it.
timeline.author: XiongKezhi

replies.bodyText:
@XiongKezhi
The pattern has been to reuse existing classes.  Then there are two options:

eagerly populate()/refresh() all the items during wrapup()/lateBind() - this results in a multiple api requests up front but returns stable fully populated objects
only populate()/refresh() each item when user requests data that is missing from partial - can save a ton of requests but adds complexity to target class (missing fields need to be guarded with checks for partial state.

In this case, the partial is so thin you should probably go with option 1.
replies.author: bitwiseman

replies.bodyText:
@XiongKezhi
Hm, but is it possible to get an event for a Repository what the repository is private and can't be populated using the current credentials?
replies.author: bitwiseman
XiongKezhi

timeline.bodyText: @XiongKezhi  You'll want to add an override for wrapUp(root) to bind GHAppInstallation
timeline.author: bitwiseman
